text: <@UGY22E2KC> I think the main factors are CX (switching subdomains, presence of cart etc), vs the ease of using HubSpot's forms, CTAs, etc. Duplication of work is also a factor - building on two CMS's means building twice.
Hi all - anyone worked within a HubSpot + Shopify environment where Shopify had lots of variants (which don't get synced to HubSpot products)? Was it a big problem?
